comments:
DS says:

I was reviewing our recent changes and remembered that we basically copied the ListenerList from your world.
We made some changes to our copy of the list to address 1GF9QKD: ITPDUI:ALL - NPE firing debug event
===========================================
DW (6/13/01 11:55:25 AM)
	Terminating a scrapbook from the toolbar.

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugPlugin.fireDebugEvent(DebugPlugin.java:110)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.JDIDebugElement.fireEvent(JDIDebugElement.java:166)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.JDIDebugElement.fireTerminateEvent(JDIDebugElement.java:203)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.JDIThread.terminated(JDIThread.java:1064)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.JDIDebugTarget.removeAllChildren(JDIDebugTarget.java:1267)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.JDIDebugTarget.terminate0(JDIDebugTarget.java:1246)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.JDIDebugTarget.handleVMDisconnect(JDIDebugTarget.java:740)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.EventDispatcher.dispatch(EventDispatcher.java:87)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.EventDispatcher$1.run(EventDispatcher.java:154)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1194)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.EventDispatcher.run(EventDispatcher.java:171)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:498)

	Looks like the listener list (debug event listeners) somehow got a null in it.
	Perhaps a race condition between remove() and getListeners(). We can remove
	a listener while a call to getListeners is happening, resulting in a null entry.

DW (6/13/01 1:51:47 PM)
	Suggest to defer.

DS (7/9/01 3:25:46 PM)
	Fix in hand requiring synchronization of add, remove, getListeners

ARCH (7/11/01 12:08:44 PM)
	fix in 1.0

DW (7/16/01 10:56:54 AM)
	Verified.

NOTES:

The UI is not multithreaded in general.
Enabling this would require a thorough review of all code, not just 
ListenerList.
